review_text:
Very quint cabin, right on the water! The hosts are very welcoming, friendly and gracious. The cabin is not ON the Wisconsin River proper, rather it's on a back channel that is situated between the main river and an island, which was nice because the boats weren't quite so loud, the water traffic not quite so busy, and bonus - water to play and fish in! The channel does have access to the river for those needing river access, and our hosts said people have docked their boat at their small dock. The water was shallow enough for us to have a blast just wading and playing in it. We also fished off their small dock both morning and evening. It's really only big enough for 2 people to fish comfortably, but was a lot of fun to have. Bonus, they have a small upper deck with a table and chairs up on the ridge overlooking the canal that is quite a peaceful spot to sit and enjoy the weather! The mosquitoes were horrendous our second night at the cabin, but not the owner's fault. They do have a bug zapper and a very nice fire pit. The owners were gracious enough to let our son borrow a life vest, and let us all borrow fishing equipment. The cabin is situated off a main road back in a small "subdivision" that is just a small collection of homes/cabins. The property is mostly wooded and very peaceful. We felt very safe and cozy. The house itself is very nice, and the owners are actively updating it! There are 2 small bedrooms upstairs with double beds. The bathroom is also small and would be cramped and crowded if too many people are staying at the house. There is a small table right off the kitchen. The kitchen is quaint and cozy and well-stocked with misc pantry items that the owners encouraged us to use. They even have fixings for spaghetti for road-weary travelers to have their first night! Plus, there were a few beer and wine offerings available had we not stopped ahead of time. Everything was clean and well-maintained. The living room was a decent size with a Roku stick for TV/movies and there are 2 couches and several games available to play. There is just a window unit for A/C upstairs. Downstairs was a pretty good size and would fit a small family on 2 twin beds and a pull-out couch. The downstairs is all one room, combining sleeping and lounging in one, and a glass sliding-door going out to the backyard. This space was a little musty-smelling and the owners said they're still working on fixing up this space. We easily fit our family of 3 in the cabin, and we think it'd easily fit another small family or a group of 4 adults.
The cabin is within 5 minutes of the small town of Nekoosa. There is no laundry at the cabin, but a laundromat in town. There was a wonderful ice cream shop in town, and a Dollar General and Piggly Wiggly for necessaries. Nekoosa is quite close to several other towns, and the municipal zoo in Wisconsin Rapids was charming. The cabin has easy access to the Wisconsin River or the two huge lakes just slightly further south. All in all we very much enjoyed our stay, and will definitely be returning when we're in the area!
